title: conferred on me by section 42 of the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Public Service Pay and Pensions
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Public Service Pay and Pensions 
Act 2017 (Section 42) (Payments to General Practitioners) (Amendment) 
Regulations 2023.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited public service pay pension act 2017 (section 42) (payments general practitioners) (amendment) regulation 2023

title: conferred on me by section 42 of the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act
heading: In these Regulations—
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations— 

“Principal Regulations” means the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act 
2017 (Section 42) (Payments to General Practitioners) Regulations 
2019 (S.I. No. 692 of 2019) (as amended by the Public Service Pay and 
Pensions Act 2017 (Section 42) (Payments to General Practitioners) 
(Amendment) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 311 of 2020), the Public 
Service Pay and Pensions Act 2017 (Section 42) (Payments to General 
Practitioners) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 685 of 
2020) and the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act 2017 (Section 42) 
(Payments to General Practitioners) (Amendment) Regulations 2022 
(S.I. No. 23 of 2022)).
text_norm: 2 regulations-- principal regulation mean public service pay pension act 2017 (section 42) (payments general practitioners) regulation 2019 (s.i no 692 2019) (as amended public service pay pension act 2017 (section 42) (payments general practitioners) (amendment) regulation 2020 (s.i no 311 2020) public service pay pension act 2017 (section 42) (payments general practitioners) (amendment) (no 2) regulation 2020 (s.i no 685 2020) public service pay pension act 2017 (section 42) (payments general practitioners) (amendment) regulation 2022 (s.i no 23 2022))

title: conferred on me by section 42 of the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act
heading: 3. Part C (1) and (2) of Schedule 2 of the Principal Regulations is
text_raw:
3. Part C (1) and (2) of Schedule 2 of the Principal Regulations is 

amended by replacing “65 years” with “45 years”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 10th February, 2023. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 The Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform consents to the foregoing 
Regulations. 

[30] 3 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Public 
Expenditure and Reform, 
31 January, 2023. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 

Minister for Public Expenditure and Reform. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

2 February, 2023. 

STEPHEN DONNELLY, 
Minister for Health. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [30]

title: conferred on me by section 42 of the Public Service Pay and Pensions Act
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

In accordance with the 2019 GP Agreement on Contractual Reform and 
Service Development, the Chronic Disease Management (CDM) programme’s 
Opportunistic Case Finding and Preventative components are to be extended 
from 1 January 2023 to GMS patients aged 45 years and older (currently 
available to GMS patients aged 65 years and older). This Regulation brings 
into effect that change to the Principal Regulations. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [30] 5
